name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: [SOUND] This lecture is about

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: Collaborative Filtering.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _In this lecture
column6: we're going to continue the discussion of Recommender Systems. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _In particular
column6: we're going to look at the approach of collaborative filtering. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: You have seen this slide before when we talked about the two

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: strategies to answer the basic question will user U like item X.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _In the previous lecture
column6: we looked at the item similarity

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: that's content-based filtering.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _In this lecture
column6: we're going to look at the user similarity. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: This is a different strategy called collaborative filtering.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _So first of all
column6: what is collaborative filtering? _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: It is to make filtering decisions for

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: individual user based on the judgement of other users and

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _that is to say
column6: we will infer individual's interest or _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _preferences from that
column6: of other similar users. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: So the general idea is the following.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _Given a user u
column6: we are going to first find the similar users

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: u1 through and then we're going to predict the used preferences based on

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _the preferences of these similar users
column6: u1 through. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: Now the users similarity here can be judged based on their similarity.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: The preference is on a common set of items.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: Now here you'll see that the exact content of item doesn't really matter.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _We're going to look at the only
column6: the relationship between the users and _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: the items.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: So this means this approach is very general if it can be

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: applied to any items not just with text objects.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _So this approach
column6: it would work well under the following assumptions. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: First users with the same interests will have similar preferences.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _Second
column6: the users with similar preferences probably share the same interests. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _So for example
column6: if the interest of the user is in information retrieval

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: then we can infer the user probably favor SIGIR papers.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: And so those who are interested in information retrieval researches probably

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _all favor SIGIR papers
column6: that's something that we make. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _And if this assumption is true

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: then it would help collaborative filtering to work well.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _We can also assume that if we see people favor SIGIR papers

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: then we can infer the interest is probably information retrieval.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _So these simple examples
column6: it seems what makes sense. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: And in many cases such as assumption actually does make sense.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _So
column6: another assumption you have to make is that there are a sufficiently large _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: number of user preferences available to us.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _So for example
column6: if you see a lot of ratings of users for movies and _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: those indicate their preferences in movies.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _And if you have a lot of such data

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: then collaborative filtering can be very effective.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _If not
column6: there will be a problem and that's often called a cold start problem. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _That means you don't have many preferences available
column6: so _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: the system could not fully take advantage of collaborative filtering yet.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: So let's look at the collaborative filtering problem in a more formal way.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: And so this picture shows that we are in general considering a lot of users and

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: showing we're showing m users here.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _So
column6: u1 through and we're also considering a number of objects. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _Let's say
column6: n objects denoted as o1 through on and _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: then we will assume that the users will be able to judge those objects and

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _the user could for example
column6: give ratings to those items. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _For example
column6: those items could be movies

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _then the users would give ratings one through five
column6: let's say. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: So what you see here is that we have assumed some ratings available for

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: some combinations.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _So some users have watched movies
column6: they have rated those movies. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: They obviously won't be able to watch all the movies and

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: some users may actually only watch a few movies.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _So this is in general a response matrix
column6: right? _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: So many item many entries have unknown values and

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: what's interesting here is we could potentially infer

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: the value of a element in this matrix based on other values and

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: that's actually the central question in collaborative filtering.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _And that is
column6: we assume an unknown function here f

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: that would map a pair of user and object to a rating.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: And we have observed there are some values of this function and

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: we want to infer the value of this function for

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _other pairs that we
column6: that don't have values available here. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _So this is ve
column6: very similar to other machine learning problems

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: where we would know the values of the function on some training there that and

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: we hope to predict the the values of this function on some test there.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: All right. So this is the function approximation.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: And how can we pick out the function based on the observed ratings?

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _So this is the
column6: the setup. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: Now there are many approaches to solving this problem.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: _And in fact
column6: this is a very active research area. _

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: A reason that there are special conferences dedicated to the problem

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: is a major conference devoted to the problem.

name: 5 - 12 - 4.7 Recommender Systems- Collaborative Filtering - Part 1 (00-06-20).srt
text: [MUSIC]
